meanings.definition: A person who rules or governs
meanings.sent1: The wise rulers of the kingdom made fair decisions for their people.
meanings.sent2: The rulers of the school ensured that everyone followed the rules.
meanings.sent3: The rulers of the land had a meeting to discuss new laws.
meanings.sent4: The rulers of the jungle were the lions, feared by all other animals.
meanings.sent5: The rulers of the empire wore golden crowns and sat on thrones.

meanings.definition: A measuring device used for drawing straight lines
meanings.sent1: The student used a rulers to draw a perfect line on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The architect always carries a rulers in his bag for precise measurements.
meanings.sent3: The rulers in the art class were all different colors and sizes.
meanings.sent4: The rulers on the desk helped the students create neat graphs.
meanings.sent5: The rulers in the toolbox were essential for the carpenter's work.

meanings.definition: A strip of wood, metal, or other material with a straight edge used for measuring or drawing straight lines
meanings.sent1: She used a rulers to draw a line across the page.
meanings.sent2: The teacher handed out rulers to the students for the geometry lesson.
meanings.sent3: The rulers in the stationery store were on sale for a dollar each.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter's rulers were worn from years of use.
meanings.sent5: The rulers in the art kit were made of clear plastic for easy visibility.
